storyInfo: News of the rehearsal has made it all across Dossoles. Miłosz has found Ela and is hoping she can persuade the community to postpone the arts festival, but both the community and Reynell have their reasons to run the festival on that exact day.

attributes.content: Last night, a pair of giant wooden puppets appeared in the street art community. Their magnificence shocked everyone who had the opportunity to see them.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: These fine puppets were created by one of the local artists, and during yesterday's rehearsal, they waltzed and fluttered under the moonlight.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: We can see from the video how they danced so elegantly under the artists' control. Almost as if they were alive!
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: The neighborhood is known for violence, gangs, and homeless, contributing to a high crime rate. It's an area that most usually steer clear of. But despite the risks, the performance last night attracted lots of visitors.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Now, let's go to our reporter on the scene and see what the attendees have to say.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Yo, Boss, un helado, por favor.
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Boss?
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Señor, what were you doing when the two puppets showed up?
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: I was jogging at the time. Suddenly, I saw a huge face between two buildings. I was so shocked, I fell to the ground.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: But then I mustered up my courage, walked over there and watched the whole performance...
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: And when it was all over, my legs couldn't stop shaking. I wasn't scared this time, though. I was stunned.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Okay. Thank you again for your time, señor.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Haha, from the way he's walking, it looks like he was telling the truth. Now let us turn the camera over to some of the artists who live here.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Maybe we can ask them why they made this pair of giant puppets? What stories will they have for us?
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Señores, señoras, please place your bets.
attributes.name: Casino Dealer

attributes.content: Shh...
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Excuse me?
attributes.name: Casino Dealer

attributes.content: Oh, look at the little girl who just walked by. She's one of the main players here. Señorita, a moment, please?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Hmm...?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: I hear you're the mastermind behind this performance. For you to take on such a major role at your age...
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Yeah yeah, get to the point. I'm busy.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Sure. What's with the two puppets?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Did you go through all that trouble to draw attention to this community?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Heh, a few years ago, two buildings in our neighborhood burned down in a fire. None of you turned your attention to us.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: A fire...?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: (Quietly) Nobody remembers... I knew it.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: The puppet show is to commemorate that fire. It's to commemorate our friends who left us that day. That's why we arranged to open our festival on the same day as the fire.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: But Galería Krysztauowa is also scheduled to have its widely anticipated opening ceremony that day. Is there any pressure from that at all?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Maybe a little before the rehearsal, but basically not at all now.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: The performance on our opening day will be even more sensational. I don't think an art museum can hold a candle to our performance.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: No matter how they spruce up their gimmicks, their opening ceremony is only there to tell us one thing—
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: That Reynell can do business.
attributes.name: Voice on TV

attributes.content: Why did you turn off the TV, Miłosz? I was watching that.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: You should get some sleep.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: I don't want to. I'm not tired at all.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Sleep.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Miłosz... Why are you frowning like that? Why aren't you happy for me?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Go to sleep, Reynell.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: It's been more than a decade. The birthday present that should've been mine is finally back in my hands. I'm delighted.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Really? Look at what a mess you are now. Say what you want, I'm not convinced.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: That music box was supposed to be mine... Before my birthday... she said she'd give me one.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: But that old bastard wasn't happy about it. How could she have made a piece with absolutely no economic value?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: She's a genius, a star. Her works are meant to be sold at exhibitions for high prices. It wasn't meant to sit on a boy's bedside table, never to be known by the masses.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: But it's made it back to you. After so many years, it returned to its rightful owner.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: I love it. Even though it's been modified beyond recognition, I love it.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: What about her, Miłosz? Will she like my gift?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Everything you've given her, she couldn't bear to let go.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Why aren't you saying anything?
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: ...I do want to sleep now, Miłosz.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: I saw you on TV. You shouldn't have showed off like that for the media.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Papá, you're the one who suggested we make the giant puppets. If you were going to worry about showing off, you should've thought of that sooner.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: *sigh*, Tecno. I just got a letter from the government.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: The letter says that if the arts festival is a success, a group of Leithanian cultural exchange representatives will come to our puppet show.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: You mean... we might get government support?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: It's more likely we'll end up at their beck and call.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Warlords, merchants, politicians. There are plenty of men with their eyes on this plot of land. We're getting too much attention in too short a period of time. It's too much pressure.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Maybe this just goes to show how useless I am.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Don't say that, Papá. Before you got here, nobody cared if this place burned for a whole day and night. There wasn't even anyone here to report on it.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: It's because you've been here for us that we got to live peaceful lives the past couple years. All of us know the work you've been putting in for our sakes.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Everything you've done, you did so we could walk under the sun again, no?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: We're another step closer to our goal now. What are you worried about?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Let me think about it some more... Tecno...
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: I can't let the rest of you walk under the sun without any protection.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Señor Miłosz, have you and Señor Reynell seen the street art community's puppet show?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: You chose to hold Galería Krysztauowa's opening ceremony on the same day as their arts festival. Certainly their successful rehearsal has taken away much of the attention that deservedly would have been yours.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Do you feel any pressure?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Please make way, ma'am.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Señor Miłosz, please answer our questions!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Sorry, but we are not planning on taking anything from the press today.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Señor Miłosz, is your silence an indication of the pressure you're under?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: That's close enough, señora.
attributes.name: Security

attributes.content: Señor Miłosz!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Is Miss Ela here yet?
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Yes. She's waiting in the exhibition hall.
attributes.name: Security

attributes.content: I need to talk to her. Make sure nobody disturbs us.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Security

attributes.content: Miss Ela, sorry to keep you waiting. You'll have to forgive me. The outside is packed with reporters.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Mr. Miłosz, why did you call me back from the art community all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: You're getting along well with them, aren't you?
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Yes, I am.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: The people there are vivacious.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: And even though some of them are sick, their urge to create is as strong as ever.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: People who call themselves artists are a dime a dozen, but I have to admit that the people there truly love art.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: What about Reynell? What do you think of him?
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: He... He's an interesting man.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Is that all?
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: I'm afraid I can't see any of that in him.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: You once told me that Mr. Szczepan's paintings made you uncomfortable. That's because you have never met him. The discomfort that his personal presence brings to others is a hundred times greater than that of his paintings.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: If it wasn't for him. You would've seen those qualities in Reynell.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Nothing is beneath Szczepan as Kazimierz's most famous artwork dealer, be it verbal attacks, threats of violence, or economic suppression.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: He will do whatever it takes to make the artists working with him follow his every command. Not even his wife, Reynell's mother, could escape this fate.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: That's a pain no creator could bear. It must have been an agonizing marriage.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: You're right. She even destroyed her own work as a form of protest, but only a week later, the damaged portrait was sold at auction for an astronomical price on account of its so-called profound philosophical meaning.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: She should've left.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: She couldn't. She couldn't leave her child to the arrogant bastard, especially a child that very much resembled herself.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: (Deep breath)
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Is there a reason you're trying to get me to sympathize with him now, of all times, Mr. Miłosz?
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: You're a sharp one, to the point that it's frustrating.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Galería Krysztauowa's opening ceremony is set to be held on the anniversary of Reynell's mother's passing. The day has a special significance to him.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Perhaps you and your team can help him out a little. Just a short while will do. If you could work it so the two events are even just one day apart.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Mr. Miłosz, but I can't.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: If you've seen the news, then you know what that day means to the community.
attributes.name: Ela

attributes.content: Miss Ela... You should do what you can. This isn't a request. It's a reminder.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: It doesn't matter how emotional or stirring their puppet show is. It will be overshadowed on the day the Galería opens.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: You're awake.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Were you outside?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Yes, I met with Miss Ela.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: What did she say?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: She refused.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: I'm not surprised.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Why did you ask me to call her back here?
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: The puppet show would be in good hands if she were to run it... And then, perhaps there would come a day when it forms an iconic performance that represents this place, as they hope it will.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: But it won't be on that day.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: I almost sympathize with them. They're spending so much time, effort, and energy on this...
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: To tell the truth, if it wasn't for the scheduling conflict, I would even go see the performance myself. Compared to the junk that the art buyers are gobbling up downstairs...
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: I'm a lot more interested in their creation.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: It's been some years since you last said you liked a particular piece.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Right. Let them be. It's just a shame...
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: No matter how overwhelming a piece of art is in the beginning, it can't compare to a magnificent death.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: The last explosives are in place. I will make the final adjustments tomorrow to ensure that everything goes as planned on the day of the ceremony.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Thank you for everything you've done, Miłosz. For me.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: No thanks necessary. Did you know, Reynell? When you talked about destruction just now, your eyes were sparkling...
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Just like when you used to talk to me about creation.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: It's just similar, that's all.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: But it's more than enough to me.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Who is it...? Why now?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: It's fine. I'll go get it.
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: How's a single phone call taking so long?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: (Mouths) He won't shut up!
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: (Mouths) Who is it?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: (Mouths) That captain!
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: (Mouths) What does he want?
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: (Mouths) What else could it be? The community!
attributes.name: Miłosz

attributes.content: Whatever. Give me the phone.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: Hello, Mr. Mateo? Yes, I'm very busy right now. If you need anything, we'll talk later.
attributes.name: Reynell

attributes.content: The man briskly hangs up the phone and rips the line out.
